item.title: Weirdest Ransom Note Ever
item.description: Back in the ’80s, it was a big deal when a frustrated satellite dish operator overrode the HBO feed for a few minutes on a Saturday night. But late last year, a saga involving a programmer whose family member’s TV set had fallen victim to ransomware shows we haven’t even scratched the surface of TV hacking. https://twitter.com/darrencauthon/status/813096722989809665 Ransomware has a long and sordid history, though it’s relatively new to television.
